Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 18th overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1966...
Released by Pittsburgh on 3/2/1966...
Signed as a free agent by Houston on 3/2/1966 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 7/31/1966 with a Fractured Hand, out for 6 weeks...
Had first career hit (triple) on 4/5/1970, off Rich P. Robertson (PIT)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1970, off Mickey Scott (CIN)...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1975...
Injured on 6/18/1976 with a Broken Foot, out for full season...
Injured on 7/13/1978 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 7 weeks...
Won World Series with Houston in 1979...
Hit for the cycle against Pittsburgh on 9/25/1982...
Injured on 4/14/1984 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 4/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $544,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/7/1986 to a 1-year deal worth $1,500,000 per year...
Drafted in 6th round, 110th overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1987...
Injured on 6/8/1993 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 5 days...
